title: Font Management Apps
content:
What font management program do you guys use?

I love the Linotype FontExplorer, and I'm wondering if you can save the "playlist" like collections. I think you can save and load a "configuration," but I can't get it to work.

I want to organize a collection of fonts by genre, and load the configurations onto two other machine that share the same font library.

Any suggestions?
author: weinziet

comments.content:
I load my hard drive with fonts and I have folders in font categories: Formal Scripts, Casual Scripts, Blackletter, Uncials, San Serif,  
Borders and Dingbats, Old Style Roman, Transitional Romans, and Modern Roman. I copied these on an external hard drive that I can transport to any of my five Macs.  
Bob Trogman
